question: What is the primary function of the Quick Connect/Disconnect Coupling (QC/DC) at some terminals?
options: To manually bolt the Marine Loading Arms (MLAs) to the ship's manifold flange.
To provide an automatic emergency release system (ERS) in case of high tension.
To quickly connect MLAs to the ship's manifold flange using a hydraulic clamping device.
To allow the transfer of inert gas through the ship's manifold.

question: A Pressure Relief Valve (PRV) is designed to automatically open under which condition?
options: When the downstream pressure exceeds the upstream pressure.
When the upstream dynamic pressure reaches its set point.
When there is a lack of fluid flow in the line.
When excessive upstream static pressure is detected.

question: What does the term "Reliquefaction" describe in the context of gas carriers?
options: The process of converting the liquid cargo back into a gaseous state for discharge.
The controlled heating of the cargo to increase tank pressure to safe limits.
The ideal process where heat is transferred into the system to produce mechanical work.
The process of converting cargo boil-off vapours back into liquid.

question: The Reverse Brayton Cycle achieves a cooling effect primarily by reversing the gas turbine cycle. What happens to the gas right before it achieves the low temperature?
options: The gas is compressed.
The gas is cooled.
The gas is expanded.
The gas is exhausted.

question: What is the defining characteristic of a Membrane Tank?
options: It is a fully self-supporting tank with independent structural integrity.
It is a non-self-supporting tank whose thin primary barrier is supported by the adjacent hull structure via insulation.
It requires only a single barrier with no need for secondary containment.
It is designed to handle pressures far exceeding 7 bar without any reliquefaction plant.

question: What is the PSA process used for in the maritime gas industry?
options: Cooling down the cargo tanks prior to loading.
Producing nitrogen for inerting.
Storing liquefied gas at atmospheric pressure.
Increasing the pressure within semi-refrigerated tanks.

question: Which pressure and temperature define the conditions for STP (Standard Temperature and Pressure)?
The Popping Pressure is the value of increasing inlet pressure at which the disk moves faster than the corresponding movement at what other pressures?
options: Only at lower pressures.
Only at higher pressures.
At both higher and lower pressures.
At exactly the set pressure only.

question: Semi-Refrigerated (SR) ships are capable of loading from and discharging to which types of storage facilities?
options: Only fully refrigerated storage facilities.
Only high-pressure gas storage facilities.
Only shore-side pipelines with high flow rates.
Both pressurized and refrigerated storage facilities.

question: A Regasification Vessel (RV) must contain which onboard system to perform its primary function?
options: A powerful Gas Compressor Unit (GCU) for increasing line pressure.
A Submerged Turret Loading System (STL) for fast mooring.
Onboard vaporisers to convert the liquid LNG into gas.
An advanced reliquefaction plant to handle all boil-off gas.
